content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main target image shows two identical structures that resemble small houses or buildings. Each structure consists of the following:

### Structure Breakdown:
- Total blocks per structure: 9 blocks
- Number of layers: 4 layers

### Spatial Arrangement (from bottom to top):
1. Bottom layer: Two blue cube blocks positioned to form the "legs" of the structure
2. Middle-bottom layer: One horizontal yellow rectangular block positioned across the blue cubes
3. Middle-top layer: Three blocks - one blue cube on the left, one red cube on the right, and one green horizontal rectangular block on top
4. Top layer: One orange triangular roof piece

## Selected Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the structure in the target image, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:

1. Blue cube blocks (index 1) - 3 per structure
2. Red cube block (index 3) - 1 per structure
3. Green horizontal rectangular block (index 8) - 1 per structure
4. Yellow horizontal rectangular block (index 9) - 1 per structure
5. Orange triangular roof piece (index 14) - 1 per structure

## Assembly Order

The logical assembly sequence would be to build from the bottom up:

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 1
    Step3: Move block with index 9
    Step4: Move block with index 1
    Step5: Move block with index 3
    Step6: Move block with index 8
    Step7: Move block with index 14
}
```

This assembly sequence constructs one of the identical structures. The same sequence would be repeated to build the second structure.
